content:
A solution of 180 mg (0.63 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 10 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring to a solution of 378 mg (1.9 mmol) of Me3SnCl and 99 mg (0.63 mmol) of dmqox, in 20 mL acetonitrile. Already, after 4 weeks, red prismatic crystals started growing from the initially clear solution. After filtration, washing with small quantities of cold H2O and acetonitrile and overnight drying, 68 mg (32% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of the red prismatic crystals were obtained. All attempts for the synthesis of 1 in absence of Me3SnCl were unsuccessful under the used experimental conditions. Elemental analysis: Calc. for C12H10N4Cu2 (%): C, 42.72; H, 2.96; N, 16.61; Cu, 37.71, Found: C, 42.63; H, 3.05, N, 16.52; Cu, 37.59.

A solution of 90 mg (0.31 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 5 mL H2O was added drop wise, with gentle stirring to a solution of 366 mg (0.95 mmol) of Ph3SnCl and 50 mg (0.31 mmol) of dmqox, in 10 mL of hot acetonitrile. A yellow precipitate was formed at once. After filtration, subsequent washing with small portions of H2O and acetonitrile and overnight drying, about 314 mg (93.4% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of yellow precipitate was obtained. All attempts to grow single crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray studies have so far ended up with the formation of microcrystalline powder. Elemental analysis: Calc. for C50H40N6Cu2Sn2 (%): C, 55.24; H, 3.68; N, 7.73; Cu, 11.69, Found: C, 55.33; H, 3.62, N, 7.67; Cu, 11.56.

A solution of 180 mg (0.63 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 10 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring to a solution of 378 mg (1.9 mmol) of Me3SnCl and 99 mg (0.63 mmol) of dmqox, in 20 mL acetonitrile. After filtration, washing with small quantities of cold H2O and acetonitrile and overnight drying, 68 mg (32% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of the red prismatic crystals were obtained. All attempts for the synthesis of 1 in absence of Me3SnCl were unsuccessful under the used experimental conditions. Elemental analysis: Calc. for C12H10N4Cu2 (%): C, 42.72; H, 2.96; N, 16.61; Cu, 37.71, Found: C, 42.63; H, 3.05, N, 16.52; Cu, 37.59.

A solution of 90 mg (0.31 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 5 mL H2O was added drop wise, with gentle stirring to a solution of 366 mg (0.95 mmol) of Ph3SnCl and 50 mg (0.31 mmol) of dmqox, in 10 mL of hot acetonitrile. A yellow precipitate was formed at once. After filtration, subsequent washing with small portions of H2O and acetonitrile and overnight drying, about 314 mg (93.4% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of yellow precipitate was obtained. All attempts to grow single crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray studies have so far ended up with the formation of microcrystalline powder. Elemental analysis: Calc. for C50H40N6Cu2Sn2 (%): C, 55.24; H, 3.68; N, 7.73; Cu, 11.69, Found: C, 55.33; H, 3.62, N, 7.67; Cu, 11.56.
